content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 540.2 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Application
means an application to the hospital forensic committee or clinical
director. (b) Certified psychologist
means a person who has been certified and registered to practice psychology in

New York State pursuant to the education law. (c) Clinical director means the person in
charge of clinical services at the facility where the patient is receiving care
and treatment. In facilities in which the director is a physician, this term
refers to the director. If the director of the facility is not a physician, this term refers to the deputy director for clinical services. (d) Commissioner means the New York State

Commissioner of Mental Health. (e) Conditional release means the act of ending a facility's inpatient period of
service to a patient without ending the facility's legal responsibility for the
patient. (f) Court means the court
which issued the order under article 730 of the Criminal Procedure Law by which
the patient was committed to the facility in which he or she is presently
receiving care and treatment. (g) Day means all days of the week excluding Saturdays, Sundays and
holidays. (h) Discharge means the
act of ending a facility's inpatient period of service to a patient and the
facility's legal responsibility for that patient. (i) Escorted furlough means any occasion on
which a patient leaves the confines of the facility where he or she is
receiving care and treatment, except for the receipt of medical care, appearance in court, or attendance at the funeral of an immediate family
member, and during which he or she is under the constant supervision of one or
more employees of the appropriate office facility. (j) Final order of observation means an order
entered by a local criminal court pursuant to section
730.40 (1) and
(2)
of the Criminal Procedure Law or by a
superior court pursuant to section
730.50
(1)
of the Criminal Procedure Law which
commits a criminal defendant found to be an "incapacitated person" to the
custody of the commissioner for a period of up to 90 days and simultaneously
dismisses the criminal charges against the defendant. (k) Hospital forensic committee or committee
means a committee established in accordance with section
540.3
of this Part. (l) Incapacitated person means a criminal
defendant found by the court, as a result of mental disease or defect, to lack
capacity to understand the proceedings against him or her or to assist in his
or her own defense. (m) Office
facility means any inpatient hospital within the Office of Mental

Health. (n) Order of commitment
means an order issued by a superior court pursuant to section
730.50
(1)
of the Criminal Procedure Law which
commits a criminal defendant accused of a felony, and found to be an
"incapacitated person," to the custody of the commissioner for a period of up
to one year, but which does not result in dismissal of the criminal charges
against the defendant. (o) Order of
retention means an order issued by a superior court pursuant to section
730.50 (2) or
(3)
of the Criminal Procedure Law at the
expiration of an order of commitment or a prior order of retention which
retains a criminal defendant in the continued custody of the commissioner for a
period not to exceed one or two years without dismissing the criminal charges
against the defendant. (p) Patient
means any inpatient committed to an office facility by a court order issued
pursuant to article 730 of the Criminal Procedure Law, or whose present status
as an inpatient is the result of his or her continued retention as a civil
patient after the expiration of such court order. For purposes of this Part, the term patient shall not include persons remanded to the custody of an office
facility pursuant to a final order of observation, as defined in subdivision
(i) of this section, or who are admitted to an office facility immediately
following a remand pursuant to such order. (q) Psychiatric examiner means a qualified
psychiatrist or a certified psychologist who has been designated by a director
to examine a defendant pursuant to an order of examination. In facilities in
which the director is not a physician, the director may delegate this authority
to the deputy director for clinical services. (r) Qualified psychiatrist means a physician
who: (i) is a diplomate of the American Board
of Psychiatry and Neurology or is eligible to be certified by that board; or
(ii)
is certified by the

American Osteopathic Board of Neurology and Psychiatry or is eligible to be
certified by that board. (s) Temporary order of observation means an
order issued by a local criminal court pursuant to Criminal Procedure Law, section 730.40(1) and (2), which applies to a criminal defendant accused but
not indicted of a felony offense and found by the court to be an "incapacitated
person" and commits him or her to the custody of the commissioner for a period
of up to 90 days, but which does not automatically result in dismissal of the
criminal charges against the defendant. (t) Transfer means the transfer of a patient
from a secure facility to a nonsecure facility. (u) Unescorted furlough means any occasion on
which a patient leaves the confines of the building where he or she is
receiving care and treatment and during which such leaving is with permission
of the facility and without the constant supervision of one or more employees
of the facility. (v) Unit chief
means the administrator in charge of the unit where the defendant is receiving
care and treatment. Notes
